Don't take this course unless it's required by your degree. Literally you won't gain much from this course.

Strength: The topic that the course talks about is very useful, especially for data analyst in the public health career in the future.

Weakness: The entire course is not organized, it's NOT clear at all. I don't understand what the professor is talking about in class. She usually sticks to small unrelated stuff and ignores very important side of the course. You cannot depend on her to explain your concerns or questions every time you point out. If you want to study after class with PPT, unfortunately, you cannot do that. Because the PPT is not clear at all. SOME WORDS ARE OUT OF BOUNDARY! You can not fix that even you really want! There are tons of typos in the PPT, including important definitions, like A is bigger than B, the professor will sometimes label it as A is smaller than B. FULL OF CONFUSION!!

I have to point out that in our homework, the professor provides us with a word document for questions. The fonts of the questions are not consistent! Some words are bigger, some are smaller, and AGAIN YOU CANNOT FIX IT. I guess the professor just copy paste some document made by Latex. But's it's really hard for us to read and understand the questions!!

Strengths: the contents of the courses are good
Weakness: the notes are not very clear
Very useful!

strengths:
1. During the process of completing the final project I learned a lot. The final presentation gives me a chance of practicing public speaking skill.
2. The lab materials are very helpful
Weakness:
1. The ppt slides are a little bit confusing
good

This class was easily the worst class I took at YSPH. The lectures were incoherent, and the professor, while nice, would often veer into long ramblings that did not make the material easier to understand. The homeworks were long and the TA sessions were so rushed that it was clear that you needed to read the slides on your own to understand anything (and even then the slides were too dense to make any sense of). I can honestly say that I could not follow what happened in this class and neither could anyone else. I think only one person would ask questions on a regular basis, and he also always seemed confused. Also the class should have been in either SAS or R, not both, as it was too hard to follow two languages at once.
The lecture is not well-organized.

learnt most of the concept by myself, the slides, the class are very difficult to follow, does not understand a word. 
Everything can be improved
difficult to follow lectures, which were unorganized and not delivered in a comprehensible manner.

I did all the homework independently and think it to be very helpful to understand the course, although it would take a lot of time to search and learn a lot of things.  I think the content of the course is very important for biostatistics. To be honest, it is difficult for the instructor to compress so many important contents into relative short classes. I hope more reference books or papers can be provided.
the content is important and could be taught in a more efficient way

This course introduced a very important statistical methods to analyze repeated measured data in epi studies. It would be more helpful if this course include more examples for the students who do not have a mathematical background.
Good
I can hardly get the points of the teacher

very responsive, always be there for questions, willing to listen and make improvements according to students feedbacks

make fewer typos in lecture notes, be more organized and illustrate the concept more using proper examples
